poem:
Tilly in Pixels

At Zurich's screen, a shimmered face,  
not flesh nor bone but algorithm trace.  
Words and gestures, borrowed dreams,  
while actors rally, it seems.  
A chorus rises, voices blend,  
for lines rehearsed shouldn't bend.  
In this coded, stolen art,  
lies the ghost of the human heart.
